About the Company #

  • Year of Establishment and Founding History:
    • Castrol’s origins trace back to Charles Cheers Wakefield, who founded Wakefield Oil Company in 1899 in England.
    • Castrol India Ltd. was established in 1910.
    • Castrol became part of the BP group in 2000.
  • Headquarters Location and Global Presence:
    • Castrol India’s headquarters are located in Mumbai, India.
    • Castrol is a global brand, with a presence in numerous countries worldwide, as part of the BP group.
  • Company Vision and Mission:
    • Castrol’s vision is to be the world’s leading provider of premium lubrication solutions.
    • Their mission involves delivering high-performance products and services that meet the evolving needs of their customers.
  • Key Milestones in Their Growth Journey:
    • Early establishment in India, contributing to the growth of the automotive and industrial sectors.
    • Continuous product innovation and expansion of product lines.
    • Integration into the BP group, strengthening its global reach.
    • Focus on sustainable solutions.
  • Stock Exchange Listing Details and Market Capitalization:
    • Castrol India Ltd. is listed on the National Stock Exchange of India (NSE: CASTROLIND) and the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE: 500011).
    • To get the most up to date Market cap information, it would be best to check a live finance website.
  • Recent Financial Performance Highlights:
    • Castrol India consistently demonstrates strong financial performance.
    • To get the most up to date financial information, it is best to review financial websites.
  • Management Team and Leadership Structure:
    • As part of the BP group, Castrol India operates under a structured management framework.
    • Information regarding the full management team can be found on financial websites and the company website.
  • Any Notable Awards or Recognitions:
    • Castrol is recognized for its brand strength and product quality.
    • They receive various industry awards for their contributions to the lubricants sector.
